rComments: This class was very enjoyable and informative. I went in with the mindset of just trying to pass, but ended up getting an A. The key to doing well is to go to office hours! He wants specific things and its more clear if you ask him about your specific topic/issues in office hours rather than only listening to his general statements in lecture.

Excellent lecturer. pleasure to have the class.  sections were pretty much useless.  If you don't enjoy the topic (he teaches defense, foreign policy, international politics stuff) then i wouldn't recommend it.  if you do enjoy that stuff take him if you can

Maybe in other classes professor was much more together, but I took him for US foreign policy and aside from putting out some highly questionable information at times, he also often didn't explain what he wanted in assignments until after they were turned in. Got a bad feeling right off the bat and took it pass/no pass. Maybe it was the subject.

he is a chill guy and great to chat with, he is still young so he cracks jokes and easy to approach BUT if you think that you are gonna take this class to boost your gpa you are ****ed cus it requires****loads of readings, and his essay topics are really confusing due to the nature of the class. If you are a POL. major take this class with ZACH

Zwald knows his stuff, he keeps his lectures interesting and isn't unfair when it comes to grading. Just make sure to go to ALL the lectures and keep um with the reading or this class could end up being ur worst nightmare!

Zwald is a fantastic professor who really knows the material he is teaching and very willing to answer questions. Grading is very easy--pretty much only gives out As and Bs.  Attending the lectures (which is completely oral--no slides/writing) and doing the reading is vital (and there is a LOT of reading.)Only 3 papers...interesting current topics.

This class was awesome.  The material got dry sometimes, but this guy knows EVERYTHING there is to know about int'l relations, and knows how to express it eloquently.  Paper topics were tough (and a bit vague), but grading was fair.  Go to lecture, and the world will make more sense every day.
